title: Type Conversion
subject: C Programming
theory:
Changing entity of one datatype into another. 
- **Implicit (Automatic)**: Small to Large (`int` -> `float`). No data loss.
- **Explicit (Type Casting)**: Forced by user. `(type) value`. Can lose data (`float` -> `int`).

examples.code:
float f = 3.9;
int a = (int)f; // a is 3 (Truncated, not rounded)
